revised_title: Rate Constants and Mechanism of Disilane Pyrolysis
tldr: The authors studied the pyrolysis of disilane and found that it decomposes into silene and monosilane, followed by silene insertion into disilane. They also determined the rate constants for silene insertion into Si-H bonds and estimated the activation energies involved in the reaction. The reaction was found to be homogeneous in its early stages, with no detectable dependence on surface-to-volume ratio.
